title: PRIV-QA: Privacy-Preserving Question Answering for Cloud Large Language Models
author: Guangwei Li (Ant Group), Yuansen Zhang (Ant Group), Yinggui Wang (Ant Group), Shoumeng Yan (Ant Group), Lei Wang (Ant Group), Tao Wei (Ant Group), ...
relevance_why: The privacy-preserving techniques discussed in this paper could inform methods for enhancing the data security of audio and speech processing tasks, especially in cloud-based applications.
background: The paper addresses the task of protecting sensitive personal information while users interact with cloud-based large language models (LLMs) during question-answering tasks.
contribution: PRIV-QA introduces a privacy preservation pipeline and the SensitiveQA dataset to secure sensitive information during user-LLM interactions, achieving high detection and recovery rates.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focused solely on protecting user queries or responses, often lacking adaptability in general QA scenarios.
technical_comparison.novelty: The proposed multi-stage sanitization pipeline classifies words based on privacy risk levels, enhancing user data protection while maintaining the integrity of responses.

key_innovation: The method utilizes a dual approach of de-identifying queries before transmission to LLMs and restoring sensitive information post-response.
real_world_impact: This framework enhances user data security in applications involving sensitive information, making it particularly valuable for industries reliant on cloud-based LLMs while ensuring a high quality of service.
limitations: The approach is primarily tested on English and Chinese, limiting its applicability to other languages.

new_terms.Local Differential Privacy (LDP): **Local Differential Privacy (LDP)** is a framework that ensures user data privacy by adding randomness to data before it is sent to a central server for processing.
new_terms.SensitiveQA: **SensitiveQA** is the first bilingual dataset designed for privacy-focused question-answering tasks, containing interactions with sensitive data.

open_sourcing: Code and dataset available at https://github.com/ligw1998/PRIV-QA
